channel.title: Ring of Wealth

item.title: Ring of Wealth
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“tank nation, post:13, topic:554250”][quote author=X-J-K-X link=topic=673174.msg4501823#msg4501823 date=1451957407]

X-J-K-X:
The code in the very first post, rareDrops(int i) is the method for handling dropping rare items.
The only code missing would be the code that handles dropping all items.

tank nation:
You don’t understand basic math?

If I have an integer with the value of 30:

And I want to make it so there’s a higher chance of that value being 0 (This is literally how your code works), then you would want to lower the number.

Since you want the chance to be 50% greater, you would remove half the number:

[code=java]private int value = 30;

if(the_player_is_wearing_a_ring) {
value = value / 2;
}[/code]

What’s 30 divided by 2? 15. In other words, that’s half.

Now instead of a 1 in 31 (Technically, since 0-31) chance, you have a 1 in 16 (0-16).

Your code then puts the value into the random method from misc, and if that is returned as 0, then it gives a rare.

So that would essentially be:

[code=java]private int value = 30;

if(the_player_is_wearing_a_ring) {
value = value / 2;
}// Now it’s 15

return Misc.random(value) == 0;
[/code]

Again, what has a greater chance here:
Rolling 0-30 to see if it hits 0
or
Rolling 0-15 to see if it hits 0

How’s this?

[code] int chanceForEmpty = 10;
int rarity = 30;
if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerRing] == 2572) {
rarity = rarity / 2;
chanceForEmpty = 10;
c.sendMessage("@blu@The ring has increased your chance at a rare drop by 10%.");
rarity = Misc.random(rarity);

}[/code]

…

int chanceForEmpty = 10; //??? WHAT IS THIS
   int rarity = 30; /// OK NPC DROP RARITY?
   if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerRing] == 2572) {
	rarity = rarity / 2;// YES /2, WE ARE NOW AT RARITY = 15
    chanceForEmpty = 10;//?!?!?!? WHAT
	c.sendMessage("@blu@The ring has increased your chance at a rare drop by 10%.");//NO IT HASNT INCREASED BY 10%
	rarity = Misc.random(rarity);//return (Misc.random(rarity) == 0);	
   }
public boolean rareDrops(int i) {
      Client c = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].killedBy];
       int npcDropRate = ((Integer)NPCDrops.dropRarity.get(Integer.valueOf(npcs[i].npcType))).intValue();
       if(c.playerEquipment[c.playerRing] == 2572) {
           npcDropRate /= 2;
           c.sendMessage("<shad=155653>Your ring of wealth helped your drop rate by 50%");
       }    
      return Misc.random(npcDropRate) == 0;
   }

Please just take that
[/quote]

Does not work for [pi] i have different things like my npc drops are in config.java not in a cfg file. But thanks[/quote]

I literally just took the snippet from your original post… Just read it. Change where you are reading the drops from then?

Edit: Now I see your problem, here’s a little example of selecting a rare drop. All you’ll need to do is convert/return the drop

    while (true) {
    ArrayList<int[]> list = findNpcDrops(npcId);
    
    int[] drop = list.get(r.nextInt(list.size()));
    int dropRarity = drop[3]; //rarity
    
    if (r.nextInt(dropRarity) == 0) {
        System.out.println("Dropped rare item. Took "+ tries + " tries");
        System.out.println("Dropped item: "+ drop[1] +" amount: "+ drop[2]);
        break;
    }
    tries++;
    }
    
    
}


static int[][] RARE_DROPS = {
    {1926, 526, 44, 20},
    {1926, 523, 2, 50},
    {1926, 525, 6, 60},
    {1326, 525, 4, 60},
    {1326, 525, 5, 60},
    {1326, 525, 12, 604},
};
static ArrayList<int[]> findNpcDrops(int npcId) {
    ArrayList<int[]> dropList = new ArrayList<>();
    
    for (int i = 0; i < RARE_DROPS.length; i++) {
        if (npcId == RARE_DROPS[i][0])
        dropList.add(RARE_DROPS[i]);
    }
    
    return dropList;
}

But honestly if this is how your drops are and you don’t know how to sort it out, I would consider upgrading.

item.title: Ring of Wealth
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“tank nation, post:8, topic:554250”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=673174.msg4501715#msg4501715 date=1451720394]

Jezus… how long have you been working on your server again?

Anyways… post the code that handles the drop rarity and dropping. Because right now all we can do is guess.

This is some of the code of my npc drops and rarity,

public static final int[][] NPC_DROPS = { // {NPCID,ITEMID,ITEMAMMOUNT,RARITY} //Bandits { 1926, 526, 1, 0 }, { 1926, 562, 2, 70 }, { 1926, 560, 2, 60 }, { 1926, 561, 2, 80 },

What’s your point?
The rarity is very clear…
Your code is also very clear on how it works. (It’s basic math. Seriously)

Sorry, but if you can’t figure it out you should go read up on Java more.
We have told you this 100 times.
(Plus I literally told you what you can do…)

he said post the code that handles the drop rarity. I did that

So I take it you totally ignored my first reply then?
[/quote]

Nope just don’t understand how that is gonna help with my coding?[/quote]

He gave you the answer. Whether you understood what the code does is a totally different story, and judging by your reply, you clearly have no idea.

Also, you were asked to post “the code that handles your drop rarity” and you posted an array

If you want any half decent help, you need to help yourself brother by just knowing the basics and having the aptitude to actually learn.

Look in npchandler for “handleDrops”, “handleDropRarity”, “dropItems” or something similar, I can’t tell you what it’s going to be but it will be close to them. Next, convert Sk8r’s example to pi garbage

if(player.wearingRing()) { //IF OUR PLAYER IS WEARING THE RING OF WEALTH
//IT WILL ONLY GET HERE IF OUR PLAYER IS WEARING THE RING OF WEALTH
     npcDropRate = npcDropRate / 2; //DO THIS IF PLAYER IS WEARING RING OF WEALTH
//SET THE CURRENT DROP RATE, TO THE "CURRENT DROP RATE / 2"
//IF OUR DROP RATE IS 10, IF WE'RE WEARING THE RING, IT WILL NOW BE 5. 50% INCREASED DROP RATE
}
if (c.playerEquipment[playerRing] == RING_OF_WEALTH_ID) { //<-- check if the player's ring id is equal to the ring of wealth item id
dropRate /= 2; //<-- halves the drop rate
}

//rest of drop code

So I just found a random source I had and I’ll show you an example.

NPCHandler

	/**
	* Dropping Items!
	**/
	
	public boolean rareDrops(int i) {
		return Misc.random(NPCDrops.dropRarity.get(npcs[i].npcType)) == 0;//rare drops, only if the random number is 0.
	}
	/**
	* Dropping Items!
	**/
	
	public boolean rareDrops(int i) {
                int dropRate = NPCDrops.dropRarity.get(npcs[i].npcType); //drop rarity
                if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerRing] == RING_OF_WEALTH) {//if our player is wearing row
                  dropRate /= 2; //divide the drop rate by 2. if the old drop rate was 1:10, it's now 1:5
                }
		return Misc.random(dropRate) == 0; //only return true if the random number = 0;
	}

Read full topic

item.title: Ring of Wealth
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

i’m trying to convert one part of this code into my pi 317 source so that I can have a working ring of wealth that gives players 50/50 chance of better success to getting a rare item. I don’t have NPCDrops.cfg all of my npc drops and rarity is in Config.java any idea on this?
I don’t have a dropRarity class also so I think there will be a problem with that too.

[font=Verdana][size=2px]"int npcDropRate = ((Integer)NPCDrops.dropRarity.get(Integer.valueOf(npcs.npcType))).intValue();"[/size][/font]

[code]public boolean rareDrops(int i) {
Client c = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].killedBy];
int rarity = 0;
int ringOfWealth = 0;
int npcDropRate = ((Integer)NPCDrops.dropRarity.get(Integer.valueOf(npcs[i].npcType))).intValue();
if(c.playerEquipment[c.playerRing] == 2572 && npcDropRate-3 > 0) {
ringOfWealth = 1+Misc.random(2);
c.sendMessage("<shad=155653>Your ring of wealth helped your drop rate by “+ringOfWealth+” ");
}
rarity = Misc.random(npcDropRate-ringOfWealth);

  return rarity == 0;

}[/code]

Read full topic
